Key Arguments: The Bill gives excessive power to the government to define truth and enforce censorship.
There is a lack of transparency and accountability in how censorship would be applied.
The Bill's definition of 'harm' is vague and could suppress freedom of speech on important issues.
Restricting freedom of speech infringes on basic human rights.
The Bill could negatively impact religious freedoms and the ability to express differing beliefs peacefully.
Notable Quotes: This is why I strongly oppose this proposed Bill and believe its impacts would be devastating for people of all beliefs and faiths in Australia.
This Bill places too much power into the hands of our government to define what truth is and to empower a censorship regime.
Restricting freedom of speech in this way is to deny Australians their basic and essential human rights.
